articles.title: Kim Jong Un Enjoys Performance Given by KPISF Song and Dance Ensemble
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Enjoys Performance Given by KPISF Song and Dance Ensemble
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, enjoyed together with Ri Sol Ju a performance "My Motherland of Songun" given by the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF) Song and Dance Ensemble.
					 Among the audience were Pak Pong Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Kyong Hui, Kim Ki Nam, Kim Yang Gon, Choe Pu Il and people's security personnel and servicepersons of the KPISF.
					
					 Put on the stage were male solo and chorus "Oh, My Motherland of Songun", chorus "General of Korea", male duet and chorus "Victors", dance "Victorious March", bayan duet "Let's Drink a Toast", female guitar ensemble "Worthwhile Life of Soldier", thungso and harmonica ensemble "The Best Country" and other numbers.
					
					 Through their presentation the artistes helped the audience look back with deep emotion on the immortal exploits the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed by providing a solid foundation for the eternal prosperity and happiness of the country and its people through their Songun revolutionary leadership all their lives.
					
					 They truthfully represented the strong will of the people's security personnel and servicepersons of the KPISF to breathe the same breath with Kim Jong Un and share the same idea and destiny with him and devotedly protect the party, social system and people.
					
					 Kim Jong Un congratulated the performers on their successful performance.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the artistes presented a splendid performance peculiar to their organization.
					
					 He said that ideological education should not be stopped even a moment at present when the imperialists' ideological and cultural poisoning is getting evermore frantic, adding that it is impossible to defend socialism when a concession is made in ideology.
					
					 He said that watching the performance, he heard not mere songs reflecting the pledges of the artistes of the Ensemble but the true voices representing the resolution of the servicepersons of the KPISF to defend the socialist system by tightly holding the swords of the revolution. He also said the performance greatly encouraged him.
					
					 He assigned the Ensemble a task to prepare well a performance celebrating the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to Vietnamese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Vietnamese President
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Vietnamese President Truong Tan Sang on the occasion of the 68th anniversary of Vietnam.
					 The message said that the Korean people are rejoiced over the fact that the Vietnamese people are achieving great success in their efforts to put the country on industrial and modern basis under the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam, sincerely hoping that everything would go on well in the future, too.
					
					 Expressing the belief that the DPRK-Vietnamese friendly and cooperative relations with long history and tradition would steadily grow stronger in conformity with the interests and desires of the two countries, the message wished the president greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Slovakia
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Slovakia
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Ivan Gasparovic, president of Slovakia, on its Constitution Day.
					 The message wished him success in his responsible work and the friendly people well-being and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Vietnamese PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Vietnamese PM
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju sent greetings to Vietnamese Prime Minister Nguyen Tan Dung Sunday on the occasion of the 68th anniversary of Vietnam.
					 In the belief that the bilateral friendly and cooperative relations favorably developing on good terms in recent years would grow stronger in all fields, the message wished the prime minister and the government of Vietnam bigger success in their work for the industrialization and modernization of the country. 
					
					 On the same day, Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his counterpart Pham Binh Minh.

articles.title: Brunei FM Visits Different Places
articles.content:
Brunei FM Visits Different Places 
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- His Highness Mohamed Bolkiah, minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brunei, and his party visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum. 
					 They made a bow looking up to the statue of President Kim Il Sung acknowledging the crowds in the square where a military parade was held in celebration of the war victory.
					
					 They offered bouquets before the sculpture "Victory" at the monument to victory in war and paid tribute to officers and men of the heroic Korean People's Army.
					
					 Being briefed on the fact that the army and people of the DPRK defeated the U.S. imperialists for the first time in history under the wise guidance of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung, they toured several halls.
					
					 They also visited Rungna Dolphinarium and watched mass gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang".

articles.title: Mining Complex, Coal-mining Machine Complex Fulfill Production Plans for August
articles.content:
Mining Complex, Coal-mining Machine Complex Fulfill Production Plans for August
 Chongjin, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Musan Mining Complex and the Ranam Coal-mining Machine Complex have boosted production in hearty response to the historic New Year address and appeal made by Marshal Kim Jong Un, overfulfilling the national economic plan for August.
					 Workers of Musan have worked hard from the outset of the month, carrying out the production plan for the concentrated iron ore at 101.1% and the plan for the total industrial output value at 100.6%.
					
					 The outdoor branch mine created a vast ore place through successive explosions, boosting the production.
					
					 Mining district No. 1 and several other districts timely examined and repaired huge excavator and rotary drilling rig and put all equipment at full capacity and thus effecting collective innovation in the ore production.
					
					 Workers of the earth removal conveyer work station operated huge cone-shape crusher and earth removal conveyer as required by the technical regulations and standard operation instructions, overfulfilling the daily plan for the earth removal.
					
					 Drivers of ore-conveying work station set up regular repair and maintenance system for big trucks and increased the actual number of trucks operating, thereby smoothly ensuring the transportation of minerals.
					
					 Workers and technicians in the field of ore dressing pooled their creative wisdom and actively drew on new inventions and rationalization proposals, drastically picking up the output of the concentrated iron ore.
					
					 The Ranam Coal-mining Machine Complex meticulously organized production and command and aroused the enthusiasm of workers, carrying out the plan for total industrial output value for August at 110%.
					
					 Workers and technicians of the complex took good care of equipment based on technology and kept the production of material definitely ahead of processing.
					
					 They have closely dovetailed the links between processes and actively carried on socialist emulation, pushing ahead as scheduled the production of custom-made equipment to be sent to several fields of the national economy. 
					
					 The complexes are pressing for the drive for increased production to greet the 65th anniversary of the DPRK with great labor achievements in the spirit with which they overfulfilled the monthly production plans.

articles.title: S. Korean Solidarity for Progress Denounces IS
articles.content:
S. Korean Solidarity for Progress Denounces IS
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress of south Korea on Aug. 28 made public a statement in denunciation of the Intelligence Service (IS) for cooking up false cases. 
					 The statement said that the IS driven to the tight corner for its crime of illegal interference in the election challenged the people by cooking up another false case. 
					
					 It is unjust that the IS and prosecution forcefully searched houses and office rooms of a lawmaker from the Unified Progressive Party and those related to it, charging them with plotting rebellion, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 They are politicians who conducted legal activities for social progress as members of a political party. 
					
					 If they had truly attempted rebellion as alleged by the authorities, there would not be the need to expose their identities.
					
					 The IS illegally opened the minutes of the south-north summit when the public voices grew louder demanding the total reform of the IS.
					
					 The case of plotting rebellion is the second political intervention and political operation aimed to mislead the public opinion demanding the probe into the truth, punishment of those responsible, total reform of the IS and the "president's" expression of her responsible stand, and downplay the crime.
					
					 The situation brings home to the people the urgency and importance of the probe into the truth about the IS's political operation and interference in the election and punishment of those responsible.
					
					 The suppression of the opposition party through the case is a distortion of the public waging candlelight actions, a challenge to the demand for the total reform of the IS and an act against history and democracy aimed to revive the "yusin" era.
					
					 We strongly demand the immediate stop and positive response to the people's candlelight action.

articles.title: S. Korean Ruling Forces' Racket of "Forces Following North" Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Ruling Forces' Racket of "Forces Following North" Slammed
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People released an article titled "Suppression should be countered with action" on August 30.
					 The article said the racket of "forces following the north" kicked up in south Korea is the only way-out for the Intelligence Service in prolonging its remaining days.
					
					 Its typical expression is the forced search of houses and offices of those concerned of the Unified Progressive Party on charges of plotting internal disturbances, the article said, adding:
					
					 The continued wild act of the conservative ruling forces would mean that the workers' action can be taken as action of overthrowing the social system.
					
					 The owner of the mad dog should be asked responsibility for the wild act by his dog.
					
					 The only user of the Intelligence Service is the "president'.
					
					 Today the Unified Progressive Party has fallen victim to the suppression under the pretext of public security but tomorrow it will be the toiling masses.
					
					 People from all walks of life, political parties and public organizations agreed to form the all-people measure committee against suppression under the pretext of public security and disturbances, and wage a joint action.
					
					 The people should pool their will and strength to defend democracy in the action against the Intelligence Service on August 31.

articles.title: Transfer of U.S. Naval Command Assailed
articles.content:
Transfer of U.S. Naval Command Assailed
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The People's Solidarity in Pusan, south Korea held a rally outside the puppet naval operational command in Pusan on August 29 denouncing the transfer of the naval command of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces to Pusan.
					 Speakers said the ground-breaking ceremony for the transfer of the naval base belonging to the U.S. forces command in south Korea is due to take place in a base of the naval operational command on that day.
					
					 Whenever they staged joint military exercises, the U.S. forces introduced to Pusan a nuclear carrier and a nuclear submarine and now it is even holding the ground-breaking ceremony to transfer the command to Pusan, the speakers said. 
					
					 A series of such crimes as robbery, rape and violence have been reported nonstop this year, too, and the U.S. military base has become the source of the environmental pollution, they deplored.
					
					 If the project is pressed forward, they will mount a massive anti-U.S. movement, terming the U.S. forces a group of criminals and robbers, they stressed.
					
					 They warned that they would form an all-citizens movement headquarters and wage protest against the transfer of the U.S. naval base which turns Pusan into crime-woven area exposed to environmental pollution.

articles.title: DPRK Anniversary to Be Marked in South Africa
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversary to Be Marked in South Africa
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The South African preparatory committee to celebrate the 65th anniversary of the DPRK was inaugurated in Mfumalanga Province on Aug. 27.
					 Bonakele Majuba, secretary of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party and the chairman of South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People, was elected the chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events including a meeting, lecture, film show and photo exhibition on the occasion of the anniversary.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Statement Supported by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Statement Supported by Swiss Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on Monday to support supreme leader Kim Jong Un's talk "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" in Rodong Sinmun, organ of the WPK, and Joson Inmingun, organ of the KPA, on the Day of Songun.
					 The statement fully supported his talk that provides the guidelines for the struggle for the completion of socialist cause and guarantees the rosy future of the DPRK.
					
					 It stressed that the DPRK would achieve great successes in building a thriving socialist country and reunifying the country by giving full play to Kim Jong Il's patriotism at the speed on Masik Pass.

articles.title: Seminars in Guinea, Pakistan Mark Day of Songun in DPRK
articles.content:
Seminars in Guinea, Pakistan Mark Day of Songun in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Seminars took place in Guinea and Pakistan on Aug. 23 and 24 to mark the 53rd anniversary of the start of leader Kim Jong Il's Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 Present there were personages of Presidency, Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association, the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry in Guinea, the Punjab Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Pakistan, the Pakistan Trade Union Federation, the Pakistan Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the Lahore Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association and other people.
					
					 A vice-chairman of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association said Kim Jong Il continued Songun leadership for over half a century.
					
					 Under his leadership the Korean People's Army has developed into an invincible army, the DPRK fortified into an impregnable fortress and remarkable changes have been made in building a thriving socialist country, the vice-chairman stated, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK exercises its independent right to the full and displays the dignity of the country and nation by relying on the strong military power built by Songun politics.
					
					 The chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea in Conakry of Guinea said the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il has been succeeded by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The secretary general of the Lahore Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association and other speakers paid tribute to Kim Jong Il for turning the DPRK into a politico-ideological power and military power upholding the banner of Songun.
					
					 They were sure that the Korean people would make further successes in the struggle to reunify the country, build an economic power and improve the people's living standard led by Kim Jong Un, identical to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar in Pakistan.

articles.title: Future of DPRK Is Bright: Foreigners
articles.content:
Future of DPRK Is Bright: Foreigners
						
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action) and the vice chairman of the British Friendship Society with Korea held meetings on Aug. 3 and 22 on their return home after participating in the celebrations for the 60th anniversary of the Korean people's great victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 Present there were figures from all walks of life of relevant countries and other people.
					
					 Eduardo Artes, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action), said that he participated in celebrations to mark the 60th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War during his visit to the DPRK and toured various places. He went on:
					
					 I came to know clearly that what the imperialists and western media said were all false.
					
					 The people in the DPRK are granted the political rights, enjoying material and cultural benefits and leading a happy life with pride and self-esteem. They are firmly defending the sovereignty and dignity united close around their leader. This appearance of the people and development of the DPRK helped me realize the advantages of Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses.
					
					 Through the visit to the DPRK, we keenly realized that it is possible and necessary to build new society in which the people enjoy the social wealth as its master, free from the yoke of imperialists, he noted, stressing that socialism of the DPRK will be invincible.
					
					 Dermot Hudson, vice chairman of the British Friendship Society with Korea, said that the future of the DPRK in which all the people are united around Marshal Kim Jong Un in single mind is bright, adding that he was convinced of the tremendous military might and economic potentials of the DPRK.
